column3: Because it's a huge change between two rcs.\n

Seems like a two-one-liners change to me, which will eliminate the rebroadcast problem.

Zero-change refactors during -rc do not seem like a big deal.
I'd somewhat prefer to pull this in 0.7; but being that its an alert I'm not able to test beyond just starting up a node with it. ACK in any case.\n

I'll send the testnet alert key to all the core devs.

And will go with consensus on pulling / not pulling for 0.7rc2.
Ok @jgarzik I hadn't done a line-by-line comparison yet. If it's just code movement, apart from the added key, it's fine for me to merge it into rc2.\n
Seems like a good thing for 0.7 IMO.\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/286dbba2d238f523b45f5649345ae89b64cbba2f for binaries and test log.\n
